page.title: 07Farming
page.content: We toured our area looking at the primary land cover and looking to see to what use the land was put. Through- out the area the land cover is one of grazing for animals,mainly cows,but in some areas,sheep.That land which is not used as grazing is being used to grow hay for silage.The river Gaunless flows through the area & the surounding land slopes very steeply to the valley bottom & makes the grazing land very undulating.Where the land is steepest and the grazing is roughest we found sheep.We found no fields being used to grow crops in the whole of our area. Whilst we were surveying the area,we also tried to identify the breed of cattle grazing the land.Most cattle in the area were Fresians,but we did find a herd of Jersey cows.We decided that the farms are dairy farms.
